analysis.Summary: Vue SFC that renders a "recent" SVG icon. It exposes a `fill` prop to control the path color and forwards any CSS classes via `$attrs.class`.
analysis.Purpose: Provides a reusable, configurable icon component representing a "recent" or "history" symbol for use throughout the application UI.

Components.name: IconRecent
responsibilities: Render an inline SVG markup with multiple <path> elements
Accept a `fill` prop to set the SVG paths' fill color

Functions.name: defineProps
Functions.purpose: Define the `fill` prop with type validation and default

analysis.Usage:
Import and register the component in a parent Vue component or auto-register via a global icon plugin. Example:

  import IconRecent from 'modules/icons/entities/IconRecent.vue';
  
  <template>
    <IconRecent fill="#ff0000" class="w-6 h-6" />
  </template>
Notes: No scoped or global <style> block – styling is driven by props and external CSS classes.
Uses CSS variable (--black) as the default fill color to adapt to theme changes.
Forwards classes via `$attrs.class` to allow sizing or custom styling from parent.
Fully functional in environments using Vue’s <script setup> syntax.
